title: Love Island's Jack Fincham has to be rescued after driving his £30k Golf into a ditch
text:
Jack Fincham was left 'shaken up' after driving his £30,000 car into a ditch this week.

The Love Island star was rescued by passers-by after apparently swerving to avoid another car in Kent.

Jack's rescuers though weren't sure who they were helping as one of them asked if he was TOWIE star Joey Essex.

Accident: Jack Fincham was left 'shaken up' after driving his £30,000 car into a ditch this week (pictured in November 2018 Instagram post)

Jack, who won the 2018 series of Love Island, was on his way to the airport when he found himself in a ditch near Joyden's Wood in Kent, report The Sun.

A family driving past quickly turned around to help, with the mum explaining: 'He seemed really thankful for the help.'

'Hilariously my son thought he was Joey Essex, but he just joked 'I wish' and explained who he was.

'He was really lovely and luckily wasn't injured – but I don't think his car was in a great shape, it was leaking all sorts.'

In a ditch: The Love Island star was rescued by passers-by after apparently swerving to avoid another car in Kent

Mistaken identity: Jack's rescuers though weren't sure who they were helping as one of them asked if he was TOWIE star Joey Essex (right)

Her husband added that the reality star 'seemed a bit shocked when I opened the door, a bit shaken up'.

An unscathed Jack managed to drive his car away from the scene, and later shared the original report on his Instagram, writing: 'Just what I needed on the way to an airport. Sorry @JoeyEssex' alongside a crying laughing emoji.

Jack recently appeared on E4 show Celebs Go Dating, marking his second onscreen attempt at finding love.

He split from Love Island girlfriend Dani Dyer in April, and was recently linked to Geordie Shore star Chloe Ferry, with the two putting on a cosy display in Ibiza in August.

All good: Jack was left unscathed but 'shaken up' by the incident, his rescuers have revealed

Jack is working hard on a new venture, revealing last month that he's training in the hopes of becoming a professional boxer.

The reality TV star had 26 amateur bouts for Eltham ABC after starting to box at the age of 14, before turning his back on the sport at 18.

He told iFL TV: 'I went back to boxing not that long ago and then started filming a TV show, so couldn't commit as much as I wanted to.'

'With boxing, you can't play boxing, you can't do it half-heartedly, you've gotta' be there every day in that gym working.'

'Now I've sort of managed to work my life around the boxing, I've gone back to it properly, and I do want to turn over, I do wanna turn pro.'
description: Jack's rescuers though weren't sure who they were helping as one of them asked if he was TOWIE star Joey Essex.
